subproject.description: The overall objective of the full Project, implemented by the UNDP, is to demonstrate and promote best practices and techniques for health-care waste management in order to minimize or eliminate releases of persistent organic pollutants and mercury to the environment. The Project will demonstrate the effectiveness of non-burn health-care waste treatment technologies, waste management practices and other techniques to avoid environmental releases of dioxins and mercury in seven strategically selected countries – Argentina, India, Latvia, Lebanon, the Philippines, Senegal and Vietnam. This national project will develop best practice health-care waste management models in Latvia through collaborations with at least one large hospital, as well as with an appropriate combination of smaller clinics, rural health and/or injection programs and pre-existing central treatment facilities.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Reducing Health-Care Waste

title: PIMS 2596 POPS FSP: Reducing Health-Care Waste
